sentences: Anastacia was born in Chicago, Illinois; her late father Robert Newkirk (of German descent) was a club-singer and her mother Diane Hurley (of Irish descent) an actress on Broadway.
section: == Life and career == | === 1968–1998: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Her parents split up when she was five years old.
section: == Life and career == | === 1968–1998: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: After her father (who had bipolar disorder) left the Newkirk family, they moved to New York City when she was a teenager.
section: == Life and career == | === 1968–1998: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: She enrolled at the Professional Children's School in Manhattan.
section: == Life and career == | === 1968–1998: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: After graduation, she worked jobs at restaurants and hair salons while pursuing a career in the music industry.
section: == Life and career == | === 1968–1998: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Anastacia was diagnosed with Crohn's disease when she was thirteen.
section: == Life and career == | === 1968–1998: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: In 1994, she sang back-up vocals on Jamie Foxx debut album Peep This, and in 1995 Anastacia sang back-up vocals on Paula Abdul's third studio album Head Over Heels.

sentences: By 1997, Anastacia had become a member of a band called The Kraze which she remained a part of until 1999.

sentences: Over the course of her life Anastacia has battled numerous health problems including being diagnosed with Crohn's disease at age 13, breast cancer at age 34, and the heart condition supraventricular tachycardia, which the singer discovered she had at age 39.
